data.title: Device Input dialog now uses containers

Fixes #6030

Sometimes the dialog size is not correctly calculated on popup:

data.title: FuncRef.call_func not found in 2.1RC2
build ios in enabled bitcode build (improvement)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
godot 2.x.x ios

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Now Apple has added the ability to assemble projects included "bitcode". This allows you to not build the project under 2 different architectures and in the future to forget about the different architectures. Most of the advertising libraries already support this function. it would be great if Godot also had the opportunity.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: macOS: documentation font is small after re-opening a project
data.body: **Operating system or device - Godot version:** macOS 10.11.6 (retina) godot 2.1 rc2 **Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): Font in the documentation becomes very small after re-opening a project. **Steps to reproduce:** - create a project - open documentation - close project - re-open the project - click on the documentation in the file/doc selector - see photo before: after re-open: *\* workaround ** Close the docs and re-open them.

This only happens since 2.1 and in combination with a 4K Monitor. With version 2.0 everything alright. **Steps to reproduce:** Open Godot 2.1 RC2 and go to 2D Mode **Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Change "Add to script" option to allow selecting scripting language option.
data.body:
Currently, if you want to select which language option you want to use, you have to do it from the "Create Node Script" popup ("Add Script" from the context menu on the scene panel).

What I would like to see is that it brings up a further sub-menu with a list of available scripting options:
![context_menu_addition png](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/324679/17398262/cf8ad0be-5a33-11e6-87e1-89ae013f20a5.png)

Which then calls up the "Create Node Script" dialogue as normal, _except that your scripting option is selected instead of whatever the default option is_:
![takes_to_dialogue png](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/324679/17398298/fb1c9f14-5a33-11e6-96cf-0b57c6733249.png)

I hope this makes sense?

data.title: Input Map dialog messed up.  2.1RC2
data.body: Mac OSX El Capitan. Godot 2.1 RC2 I wanted to add an input map for a joystick button, but the dialog to do so is compressed. -Go to Project Settings. -Go to the "Input Map" tab. -Press "+" on any input and choose "Joy Button" or "Joy Access". -The little window that lets you choose which joystick and which button is messed up.

data.title: Most bottom panels don't give way to Output when project is played
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 2.1 RC1 Windows 7

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Normally, when you play a project from the editor, the Output panel pops up, and it closes again when you stop. This makes sense. If your game doesn't take up the whole screen when run, you always see the Output log when it's running. However, if another bottom panel—generally the animation panel, also the SampleLibrary panel that I know of, and probably others—is open when you hit play, the Output panel doesn't replace it. Unless the other open panel is the Debugger, that gets replaced by Output, which I'm assuming is the way it's supposed to work. (the way I expect it to work.) 

This has been a constant annoyance to me for a long time, though I didn't think about it too much until now. I have often left the animation panel open when I press play, so then I look and don't see the output log, swear, pause the game, alt-tab to the editor, close the animation panel, open the output panel, alt-tab back to the game, and resume.

data.title: Interpret comma as decimal point in editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux (Manjaro) - v2.2 alpha (git custom build)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you use a German keyboard layout (and maybe other layouts), the "decimal point" is a comma. If you insert numbers into the editor's fields (e.g. the translation) it would be nice if this comma would be automatically replaced by a decimal point. Blender does the same and it this little fix would enhance the workflow.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Godot edits and saves .tscn without consent!
data.body:
I've pulled form git my game, opened it in Godot 2.1 editor, and then I saw in my shell that files have changed! **But I've not even saved anything!**

here's git diff:

``` diff
diff --git a/main.tscn b/main.tscn
index abc0021..31c1cd7 100644
--- a/main.tscn
+++ b/main.tscn
@@ -273,3 +273,5 @@ geometry/depth_scale = false
 geometry/visible_in_all_rooms = false
 geometry/use_baked_light = false
 geometry/baked_light_tex_id = 0
+
+
```

data.title: Better root path for assetlib unzipping
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux x64, Godot "master"

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
As I was installing the all-new GroupManager plugin (by @kubecz3k ), it failed to install it in the res://addons folder, but unzipped it in the root folder instead. With @akien-mga we discussed on IRC that `res://addons/<name>/` would be way better for an install path for non-templates. @reduz WDYT?

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download any asset from asset lib, it would install it in res://, not in res://addons/<name>/

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: VisualScript module does not build with tools=no
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All, git master head

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Check the failed android and iphone build jobs on Travis: https://travis-ci.org/godotengine/godot/builds/149322235

Typically there's an issue with TTR:

```
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp: In member function 'void VisualScriptEditor::_member_edited()':
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:662:84: error: no match for 'operator+' (operand type is 'String')
   EditorNode::get_singleton()->show_warning(TTR("Name is not a valid identifier: ")+new_name);
                                                                                    ^
```

data.title: Fix set_window_size not setting the correct size on OSX
data.body: On OSX set_window_size was missing always 22px for the height, since setFrame param uses the window size including the bar height, this PR adds the menu bar height into the rect.

data.title: New project dialog that remembers your last folder
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
I'm using OS X, but I suspect all would appreciate this

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Every time I start a new project I have to head back to // then traverse through my folders to where I keep my GoDot projects. 

In my case it's: /Users/username/Documents/Development/Game Dev/GoDot/

That's a total of 6 double clicks every time.  It would be nice if it remembered the last location or even better, perhaps a favourite list of folder?  Recently used folders even?  Something to make it a little quicker.  

I hope the feedback is welcome.  Great work on GoDot, am very grateful for it and thank you all.

data.title: Button 'pressed' signal is called when released, and 'released' is not called
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4 and 2.1 rc1, Windows 10 64 bits

`Button` (inheriting `ButtonBase`) defines `pressed` and `released` signals. However, only one of them gets triggered, and at the wrong moment:
`pressed` triggers when the button is released,
`released` is never triggered.

I expected `pressed` and `released` to be called at the moment indicated by their name.

Repro:
[ButtonReleased.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/398409/ButtonReleased.zip)
Play the main scene, press, and release the button.

data.title: On Quit To Project Manager Dialogues Don't Go To Home Directory
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu MATE 15.10, Godot 2.1-rc1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Upon going to the Project Manager from the editor (hitting CTRL + SHIFT + Q) the New Project and Import dialogues don't go back to the home directory like they do if you'd just launched it from the executable. Instead the New Project and Import dialogues go to the directory where the Godot executable is. It's inconvienant because my Godot is in "/opt/" (although others might put it in /usr/bin) and my Godot projects are in "/home."

**Steps to reproduce:**
Place Godot some where other than in "/home" and from the editor hit CTRL + SHIFT + Q.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: emit_signal() doesn't checks if the signal exists
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4 and 2.1 rc1, Windows 10 64 bits

When emit_signal() is called in GDScript, you can actually send one that was never declared with the `signal` keyword.
This is error-prone because you can end up emitting a signal successfully while it's actually a wrong one that was never declared. It took me some time to debug this in my project, to realize I made a typo in `emit_signal`.

I expected an error to occur when sending a non-existent signal, because that's the point of declaring them with `signal`.

Repro:
[EmitSignalNoCheck.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/398326/EmitSignalNoCheck.zip)
Play main scene, click on the button.

data.title: Directory.make_dir_recursive does not work in user://
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, git master HEAD

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
`Directory.make_dir_recursive("user://test")` does not work, while `Directory.make_dir("user://test")` does.
By does not work, I mean that it does not create the directory, and errors out with `ERR_CANT_CREATE`.

I started debugging this in DirAccessUnix: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f9bd038/drivers/unix/dir_access_unix.cpp#L202-L206

```
DirAccessUnix::make_dir(String p_dir) {
...
    print_line(p_dir);
    print_line(get_current_dir());
    print_line(get_current_dir().plus_file(p_dir));

    if (p_dir.is_rel_path())
        p_dir=get_current_dir().plus_file(p_dir);
    print_line(p_dir);

    p_dir=fix_path(p_dir);
    print_line(p_dir);
...
```

The above debug prints that I added myself give the following results:
- for `make_dir("user://test")`:

```
  user://test                                  // p_dir
  user://home/akien/godot-logger               // get_current_dir() (the "user://" part is actually wrong, it should be "/"
  user://home/akien/godot-logger/user://test   // get_current_dir().plus_file(p_dir)
  user://test                                  // p_dir, after the previous result is assigned...
  /home/akien/.godot/app_userdata/Logger/test  // previous one after "fix_path"

--> Folder properly created in /home/akien/.godot/app_userdata/Logger/test
```
- for `make_dir_recursive("user://test")`:

```
  user://test              // p_dir
  res://                   // get_current_dir()
  res://user://test        // get_current_dir().plus_file(p_dir)
  user://test              // p_dir, after the previous result is assigned...
  user://test              // previous one after "fix_path"

--> Nothing created, ERR_CANT_CREATE
```

data.title: [Suggestion] Visually Linking Nodes
data.body:
One thing that I think will help _tremendously_ with map creation is the ability to link nodes together on the scene editor.  This idea came from using the `ImpactJS` engine years ago. 

Example:
![](http://impactjs.com/files/weltmeister-tutorial-entities.png)

Godot's version:
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/17345326/49ca7a76-58ba-11e6-89d8-7285d8ab7688.png)
I'm not sure if this is possible already (havn't found anything yet :8ball: ), but I think this would make complex map creation much easier. And also resulting in much more complex games / maps being created with Godot :)

data.title: Edited Shortcut Key on Editor Settings follows Scene Undo Redo system
data.body:
Win 10 x64 - 2.1rc1 at 3eb3752

=> happened:
Edited Shortcut Key on Editor Settings follows Scene Undo Redo system.

=> expected:
Edited Shortcut Key on Editor Settings should not follow Scene Undo Redo system. It should be independent, so that when I press Ctrl+Z, Modified Shortcut Key doesn't revert to it's original state (default value)

![editorsettings_shortcuts_-_follows_undoredo_system](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10663548/17342437/6952d456-5923-11e6-8fa3-15ad5f0b502e.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1.) Open a project using Godot (3eb3752 or later)
2.) Goto Editor Settings --> Shortcuts --> Edit or Change a Shortcut Key
3.) Close Editor Settings window
4.) Press Ctrl+Z (undo)
5.) Our edited shortcut key back or reverted to its default state.
6.) Press Shift+Ctrl+Z (redo)
7.) Our edited shortcut key going to a state where we had modified it.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
None

data.title: Godot 2.1 HiDPI Crash on Windows 10 [PNG file corrupted by ASCII conversion]
data.body:
I'm using Godot 2.1 RC on Windows 10 and have the same error as #5168.  Created new issue because I can't reopen that one, but can still reproduce the error.  Also, though the previous poster's screen was not large enough for hidpi, mine is.

I have a qhd screen on my laptop, and the engine runs fine in Auto - it just defaults to lowdpi.  If I set hidpi it hangs before reaching the project select and loops the same series of errors to the console as #5168:

`ERROR: _png_error_function: PNG file corrupted by ASCII conversion
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:60
libpng error: PNG file corrupted by ASCII conversion
ERROR: ImageLoaderPNG::_load_image: PNG Corrupted
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:94
ERROR: _load_mem_png: Condition ' err ' is true. returned: Image()
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:297
ERROR: RasterizerGLES2::texture_set_data: Condition ' p_image.empty() ' is true.
   At: drivers\gles2\rasterizer_gles2.cpp:962`

If I select a project, the same errors loop again and the editor crashes for good.

I'm wondering if perhaps it doesn't play nice with Windows' high dpi settings, as when it finally launches, everything is large/zoomed in.  Disabling display scaling in the .exe properties plops the scale back to normal, but doesn't fix the hang/errors.

data.title: Added texture filtering and char spacing for DynamicFont
data.body:
Adds properties for texture filtering and mipmaps in DynamicFont. This should allow better control when scaling. By default it is off to follow the old behaviour.

Example (4.5x scale):
Old / No Filtering
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/17325337/e7bcb00e-58a2-11e6-91e3-078505a1892e.png)

With Filtering
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/17325336/e7b41ca0-58a2-11e6-8ca9-f8fd5693def7.png)

Adds properties for adding extra spacing between characters, ascent, descent, and space width, similar to how BitmapFont worked.

![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/17325536/0846e0c8-58a4-11e6-8e02-364961931602.png)

Also, to make this change work with labels, I modified the Label class to check for kerning when calculating string sizes.

data.title: Have "changing" and "changed" signals in Range controls
data.body:
Currently, there is only one `value_changed` signal in Sliders, which is called continuously as the user drags the thumb. This is fine to be able to see the change as we change the value, however when the change is heavy, having it to update continuously results in lag.

The idea is to have two signals then:
`changing` which is called while the user drags the slider
`changed` when the user finished to drag the slider (or whatever names make sense).

Note: I think it would also make UndoRedo easier to implement because we would know when editing finishes.
